p.s: The sequence introduces Starr and her family in relationship to each other.
The scene also underlines police violence against the black community.
The sequence also introduces Maverick and Lisa as caring parents.
The scene is pretty important for the outcome of the movie, because the relationship between Maverick and King is emphasized.
The relationship between Maverick and King will play an important role in course of the movie.
The function of the sequence is to highlight the rivality between Maverick and King and to point out the police violence against the black community.
The sequence starts with close-ups of a high number of Starr and her family, which mainly show the happy mood of them.
Starr and her family are praying, which means they are thankful for themselfesthemselves.
An extreme close-up shows Starr is non-verbal communicating with her mom while praying.
The extreme close-up focussesfocuses on StarrsStarr's eyes, while Lisa prays for Starr and her school career.
This emphasizes Lisa as a caring parent.
In a sudden everything changes, in front of the restaurant King and two of his gang members look to Starr and her family.
The camera first shows Starr looking scared out of the window.
The viewer wants to see what Starr looks for.
This intensifies the action.
Then the camera zooms in towards King from StarrsStarr's point of view.
Maverick then also sees King, he tells Lisa to stay here.
At this point everything changes, no more emotional music and happy faces.
Maverick goes outside and confronts King, they seem like rivals.
Then the sirenesiren of a police car sets in and the blue and red lights change very fast and also the high number of cuts make the moment appear hectic.
King drives away, the acceleration of the car and the tires emphasize King wants to get away.
The officers put Maverick down in front of the family.
The officers realize Starr is the witness, a moment of silence emphasizes.
The over-the-shoulder shots intensify the action when the police officers walk to Maverick.
